facts.text: The Colorado Rapids won the MLS Cup in 2010.
The Colorado Rapids were founded in 1995.
The Rapids lost to D.C. United in their first MLS Cup appearance in 1997.
The Colorado Rapids were runners-up in the 1999 U.S. Open Cup, losing to the Rochester Raging Rhinos.
Marcelo Balboa became the first player to score for the Colorado Rapids in 1996.
The Rapids moved to Dick's Sporting Goods Park in Commerce City during the 2007 season.
The Colorado Rapids were one of the ten founding clubs of Major League Soccer.
Chris Henderson scored a mid-air scissor kick goal in the 87th minute in the Western Conference final to ensure Colorado's place in the 1997 MLS Cup final.
Marcelo Balboa's bicycle kick was named the Goal of the Year in 2000.
Paul Bravo scored in the 97th minute against the Los Angeles Galaxy to clinch a playoff spot for the Rapids in the final game of the 2000 season.
The Colorado Rapids set a new MLS record for the lowest home Goals Against Average in a season at 0.53 by only allowing eight goals in 15 matches at Invesco Field.
The Rapids' 16-game home undefeated streak was broken by Kansas City on June 9.
Jeff Plush was named Managing Director of the Colorado Rapids in January 2006.
The Colorado Rapids changed their club colors to burgundy and blue to align with other clubs owned by Kroenke Sports Enterprises.
Dick's Sporting Goods Park, the world's largest professional soccer stadium and fields complex owned by Kroenke Sports Enterprises, opened in March 2007.
The Colorado Rapids hosted and won the rights to produce the 2007 MLS All-Star Game.
Herculez Gomez became the first player to score in the Rapids' brand new stadium, Dick's Sporting Goods Park.
The Colorado Rapids won the MLS Reserve League for the second consecutive year in their inaugural year at Dick's Sporting Goods Park.
Gary Smith took over as the interim head coach of the Colorado Rapids with 11 games left in the 2008 season.
The Colorado Rapids were eliminated from playoff contention in the last game of the 2008 season against Real Salt Lake, which ended in a 1-1 tie.
Gary Smith was in his first full season as head coach of the Colorado Rapids in 2009.
Steve Guppy, an ex-England international, was appointed as assistant coach to Gary Smith at the Colorado Rapids in 2009.
Pablo Mastroeni re-signed with the Colorado Rapids for four years in 2009 after considering offers from Europe.
The Colorado Rapids replaced goalkeeper Bouna Coundoul with former QPR and Chicago Fire goalkeeper Matt Pickens.
In 2010, the Colorado Rapids made several roster moves, including signing Danny Earls, Jeff Larentowicz, Claudio Lopez, Quincy Amarikwa, Ian Joyce, and Wells Thompson.
Conor Casey signed a new contract with the Colorado Rapids in the offseason before the 2010 campaign.
The Colorado Rapids won their first MLS Cup championship in 2010 by defeating FC Dallas 2-1 in the finals.
Conor Casey equalized in the second half of the 2010 MLS Cup final, which eventually led to the Colorado Rapids winning the championship.
In 2011, the Colorado Rapids signed Sanna Nyassi and Tyrone Marshall from Seattle Sounders FC, and Joseph Nane and Josh Janniere from Toronto FC.
Caleb Folan, an Irish International and former Hull City striker, signed with the Colorado Rapids in 2011.
The Colorado Rapids automatically qualified for the group stages of the 2011–2012 CONCACAF Champions League by winning the 2010 MLS Cup.

Miguel Comminges, a Guadeloupe International, signed with the Colorado Rapids on September 9, 2011, and made his debut on September 13, 2011, in a CONCACAF Champions League match against Club Santos Laguna.
Oscar Pareja was appointed head coach of the Colorado Rapids following the departure of Gary Smith for the 2012 season.
Conor Casey, the all-time leading goal scorer for the Colorado Rapids, was released before the 2013 season.
The Colorado Rapids finished the 2013 season with a record of 14 wins, 11 losses, and 9 ties, placing them fifth in the Western Conference.
Pablo Mastroeni was named the head coach of the Colorado Rapids following Oscar Pareja's departure.
Under Pablo Mastroeni's first year as head coach, the Colorado Rapids finished eighth in the Western Conference and seventeenth overall.
The Colorado Rapids were eliminated from the U.S. Open Cup by the Atlanta Silverbacks during Mastroeni's first year as head coach.
The Colorado Rapids acquired Shkelzen Gashi, Marco Pappa, Jermaine Jones, and Tim Howard by the summer transfer window following the 2015 season.
The Colorado Rapids went on a 15-game unbeaten streak during the 2016 campaign.
The Colorado Rapids lost to Seattle Sounders with a 3–1 aggregate in the Western Conference Championship during the 2016 campaign.
Pablo Mastroeni was fired as head coach of the Colorado Rapids by the end of the 2017 season.
In 2018, Anthony Hudson was hired as the coach for the Colorado Rapids.
The Colorado Rapids were eliminated from the 2018 CONCACAF Champions League by Toronto FC.
Dominique Badji, the Rapids' leading goalscorer in 2017, was traded to FC Dallas for Kellyn Acosta in 2018.
The Colorado Rapids finished the 2018 season in 10th place in the Western Conference with a record of 8 wins, 19 losses, and 7 draws.
Conor Casey was named interim head coach of the Colorado Rapids on May 1, 2019, after the team parted ways with Anthony Hudson.
Robin Fraser was named the ninth permanent head coach of the Colorado Rapids on August 25, 2019.
The Colorado Rapids' first ever win at Rio Tinto Stadium occurred on September 12, 2020, with a 5–0 victory over Real Salt Lake.
The Colorado Rapids clinched a playoff berth with a 1–0 win at Portland Timbers on November 4, 2020.
Sam Vines and Cole Bassett were named to MLS 22 Under 22 for a second consecutive year in 2020.
The Colorado Rapids changed their primary uniform color to black and blue for the 2003 season.
In what year did the Colorado Rapids move into Dick's Sporting Goods Park?
What colors did the Colorado Rapids change to in preparation for the 2007 season?
Burgundy and blue
How many logos has the Colorado Rapids had in their history?
Three
What year did the Colorado Rapids undergo an image change to black and blue vertical stripes?
What are the primary colors of the Colorado Rapids' uniforms as of the 2007 season?
Burgundy (Pantone 202) and sky blue (Pantone 278)
Which Scottish pop band, related to a Rapids player, wrote the official anthem "Burgundy Sky" for the Colorado Rapids?
Little Eye
When did the Colorado Rapids announce their jersey sponsorship deal with Ciao Telecom?
May 2014
Who was the Colorado Rapids' jersey sponsor starting in November 2022?
UCHealth
What is the capacity of Dick's Sporting Goods Park?
How much did it cost to construct Dick's Sporting Goods Park?
$131 million
The Colorado Rapids' first home stadium was Mile High Stadium, which they shared with the Denver Broncos until September 8, 2001.
The Rapids moved to Invesco Field at Mile High in January 2002 after the closure of Mile High Stadium at the end of the 2001 season.
From 1996 through the 2014 season, the Colorado Rapids won about 65% of their matches at home and only 29% of their games on the road.
Real Salt Lake joined Major League Soccer in 2005 and became the Colorado Rapids' closest neighbor, leading to the creation of the Rocky Mountain Cup.
In 2002, the Colorado Rapids led Major League Soccer in average fan attendance per game.
The Colorado Rapids had 3,561 season ticket holders in 2012, a fact revealed after the club's front office mistakenly emailed a spreadsheet containing the list of season ticket holders.
On February 9, 2013, the leaders of the Colorado Rapids' three supporters groups announced they would combine into one group named Centennial 38.
Major League Soccer mandated in 2007 that every game must be televised, either through a regional/local TV station or a national channel.

Richard Fleming, a former BBC sports broadcaster with 16 years of experience, including covering the FIFA World Cup and the English Premier League, joined the Colorado Rapids broadcast team before 2013.
Starting from 2023, every Colorado Rapids match is available via MLS Season Pass on the Apple TV app.
The Rapids Gallery of Honor was established in 2003 to honor the club's all-time top players.
Marcelo Balboa and Paul Bravo were the two inaugural entrants into the Rapids Gallery of Honor in 2003.
The Colorado Rapids won their only MLS Cup in 2010.
The Colorado Rapids were MLS Reserve Division Champions in 2006 and 2007.
The Colorado Rapids have won the Rocky Mountain Cup 6 times, with their victories coming in 2005, 2006, 2013, 2015, 2020, and 2024.
Drew Moor was inducted into the Rapids Gallery of Honor in 2023.
The Colorado Rapids named Gary Smith as their head coach on November 11, 2008.
The Colorado Rapids won the MLS Cup Championship in 2010.
Pablo Mastroeni was fired from his position as the head coach of the Colorado Rapids on August 15, 2017.
The Colorado Rapids hired New Zealand's national team coach, Hudson, as their coach, as reported on April 20, 2019.
FC Dallas traded Kellyn Acosta to the Colorado Rapids for Dominique Badji on July 23, 2018.
The Colorado Rapids paid $1.7 million to release Shkëlzen Gashi, as reported on March 11, 2019.
Conor Casey served as the interim boss of the Colorado Rapids, as mentioned in a report on April 20, 2019.
Robin Fraser was appointed as the head coach of the Colorado Rapids, with the announcement archived on August 25, 2019.
The Colorado Rapids acquired defender Auston Trusty from the Philadelphia Union, with the announcement archived on November 21, 2019.
The Colorado Rapids acquired defender Lalas Abubakar from Columbus, with the announcement archived on November 21, 2019.
The Colorado Rapids signed two-time MLS Cup champion Drew Moor, with the announcement archived on December 7, 2019.
The Colorado Rapids were founded in 1995 and are based in Commerce City, Colorado.
The Colorado Rapids have won the MLS Cup in 1997 and 2010.
The Colorado Rapids' home stadium has been Dick's Sporting Goods Park since 2007.
The Colorado Rapids have a rivalry with Real Salt Lake, competing for the Rocky Mountain Cup.
The head coach of the Colorado Rapids as of 2024 is Armas.
The Colorado Rapids were MLS Cup champions in 2010.
The Colorado Rapids have had multiple head coaches, with Fraser serving from 2019 to 2023 before Armas took over in 2024.
D.C. United won the MLS Cup in both 1996 and 1997.
LA Galaxy has won the MLS Cup five times as of 2024 (2002, 2005, 2011, 2012, 2014).
The Columbus Crew won the MLS Cup in 2020 and 2023.
The Colorado Rapids have been playing at Dick's Sporting Goods Park since 2007.
Zack Steffen is a goalkeeper (GK) for the Colorado Rapids and is from the USA.
Rafael Navarro, a forward (FW) from Brazil, plays for the Colorado Rapids wearing the number 9.
The Colorado Rapids participated in a U.S. Open Cup game at the North Area Athletic Complex in Arvada, Colorado, in 2003.
Kévin Cabral, wearing the number 91, plays as a forward (FW) for the Colorado Rapids and is from France.
Arsenal F.C. has been under the ownership of Stan Kroenke since 2011.
The Colorado Rapids' home stadium changed from Mile High Stadium to Invesco Field at Mile High in 2002.
Who was the head coach of Colorado Rapids from January 4, 2014, to August 15, 2017, with a winning percentage of 30.89%?
Pablo Mastroeni
Which player was the top goalscorer for Colorado Rapids in the 2022 season with 16 goals?
Diego Rubio
As of 2023, how many total matches has Colorado Rapids played against LA Galaxy?
85 matches
Who served as the General Manager of Colorado Rapids from 1997 to 2005?
Dan Counce
In what year did Colorado Rapids finish 1st in their conference with an average attendance of 12,014?
What was the winning percentage of Chris Armas as head coach of Colorado Rapids as of November 17, 2023?
Which team has Colorado Rapids defeated 5 times, as recorded up to 2023?
Austin FC
How many goals did Kei Kamara score in the 2019 season to become the top goalscorer for Colorado Rapids?
14 goals
The San Jose Earthquakes have the highest total of wins, losses, and draws combined among the listed teams, with 78.
Real Salt Lake has the second-highest total of wins, losses, and draws combined among the listed teams, with 59.
Pablo Mastroeni has the highest total appearances (MLS, Playoffs, US Open Cup, Continental) among the listed players, with 245.
Conor Casey is the top scorer among the listed players, with 53 goals across all competitions (MLS, Playoffs, US Open Cup, Continental).
The New York Red Bulls have the highest total points among the listed teams, with 44.
Sporting Kansas City and San Jose Earthquakes are tied for the highest number of wins in Continental competitions among the listed teams, with 26 each.
Toronto FC participated in the CONCACAF Champions League Round of 16 in 2022, finishing with 1 win, 1 loss, and a goal difference of 0 (1 goal for, 1 goal against).

Drew Moor has made 223 total appearances (MLS, Playoffs, US Open Cup, Continental) from 2009–2015 and 2019–2023, making him the player with the second-highest total appearances among the listed players.
The Tampa Bay Mutiny, a defunct team, has a total of 15 points from wins, losses, and draws combined.
In the 2018 CONCACAF Champions League, Toronto FC was eliminated in the Round of 16 with 0 wins, 1 loss, and 1 draw, scoring 0 goals and conceding 2.
